channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Farm bailout news coming next Tuesday, Bessent says
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Thursday that the Trump administration would release details next week on "substantial support" for American ...

item.title: Axios Vibes: Grocery price pain rises, in warning sign for Trump and GOP
item.description: Data: Harris/Axios Vibes poll; Chart: Axios Visuals Americans say it's harder to afford their groceries now than it was a year ago, a warning sign for...

item.title: Energy Department ends billions in green awards after Vought post
item.description: The Energy Department said Wednesday night it's terminating $7.56 billion worth of financial awards that support 223 projects funded via several of it...

item.title: The sombrero videos Trump keeps posting, explained
item.description: President Trump and other Republican officials are spreading videos of Democrats wearing sombreros and handlebar mustaches on social media, prompting ...

item.title: The shutdown's quiet power broker: What to know about Russ Vought
item.description: Office of Management and Budget Director Russell Vought is behind the scenes of the Trump administration's response to the ongoing government shutdown...

item.title: Trump administration approval of new abortion drug infuriates the right
item.description: The FDA has little latitude to reject generic versions of approved drugs, but that hasn’t stopped an outrcry from abortion opponents.

item.title: Senior government officials privately warn against firings during shutdown
item.description: The Trump administration has telegraphed that mass firings are coming, but officials have cautioned that such moves could violate appropriations law.

item.title: Is Congress still getting paid? Your shutdown questions, answered.
item.description: Chief political correspondent Karen Tumulty and federal government reporter Hannah Natanson answered your questions.

item.title: Vance downplays Trump post of Jeffries in sombrero: ‘I think it’s funny’
item.description: Vice President JD Vance on Wednesday characterized Trump’s AI-generated post of Rep. Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY) as “funny,” pushing back on criticism of t...

item.title: Tracking who Trump is appointing to fill key administration roles
item.description: Follow President Trump’s progress filling over 800 positions, among about 1,300 that require Senate confirmation, in this tracker from The Washington ...

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Former Trump statistics chief slams Friday firing of Erika McEntarfer
item.description: Bill Beach said the president's suggestions that the jobs report was rigged betrayed a misunderstanding in how those numbers are assembled.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
